name: 100% Pure Olive Oil Soap with Evil Eye Bead
description:
Our soaps are produced by Midas Brand in Turkey.  They are one of the largest Olive Oil producers and their soaps are made with %100 pure Olive Oil.  They contain no chemicals or animal byproducts.  

A natural cleansing and moisturizing soap produced by traditional Aegean techniques with olive oil, water, sodium chloride, sodium hydroxide, essential oil of daphne and dried daphne.  No added bleaching agent, foaming agents or chemical scents.  It has natural colour.  No added animal products.  Not tested on animals.

100% Olive Oil
Net weight: 100gr/3.5 oz
Hand Made in Turkey

name: 100% Pure Olive Oil Soap Squares
description:
Our soaps are produced by Midas Brand in Turkey.  Still a small business owned by the same family for generations they continue with the same technique.  They are one of the largest Olive Oil producers in Turkey.  Their soaps are made with %100 pure Olive Oil.  They contain no chemicals or animal byproducts.  

A natural cleansing and moisturizing soap produced by traditional Aegean techniques with olive oil, water, sodium chloride, sodium hydroxide.  No added bleaching agent, foaming agents or chemical scents.  It has natural colour.  No added animal products.  Not tested on animals.

100% Olive Oil 
Net weight: 100gr/3.5 oz 
Hand Made in Turkey

name: Kese-Hamam Standard-General Skin
description:
Once you have been in steam for a while, your skin loosens up and is ready for the "Kese".  Slip your hand into the Kese; wrap your wrist with the strap.  Start scrubbing.  You can do circular motions or up and down.  Make sure you do this gently in the beginning as your body yet is not used to it.  The dirt and the dead skin cells will start coming off.  Do not use soap during this process.  Once you have scrubbed your entire body, rinse off.  I would highly recommend using cold or cooler water after exfoliating to shrink your pores down. 

Once your body is rinsed with cooler water, cooler than lukewarm that is, you can raise the temperature and soap up in the temperature you desire.  Your skin cells die every seven days.  Do not use Kese more than once a week.  Exfoliating with Kese will help your skin be free of any growths, help circulate blood better and feed the skin cells. 

By removing dead skin cells, you will generate new skin cells much faster and have healthier skin in relatively short time.

Polyester & Viscose (Beech Fiber) Mix.

name: Kutnu Crossover Bags
description:
I always wanted bags made with Kutnu fabric and, I  collaborated with Nurdan Deniz of Mermaid Design to create these crossover bags.  We designed a simple bag that is functional and also is very Ottoman Empire style.

(This fabric is delicate, we recommend to spray it with Scotchgard.)

"Kutnu" used to be woven in a hand looms and were produced only by a handful of people.  They were dyed with special herbs and roots.  There are even less people weaving Kutnu now and it is being mass produced in factories in limited quantities.  Royals of the Ottoman Empire wore clothing made from Kutnu.  This beautiful fabric will bring you much joy.

Handmade in Turkey by Nurdan Deniz. (I sewed the shoulder straps :) )

categories.name: Ottoman KUTNU Shoulder Bags by Nurdan Deniz

name: Ottoman "KUTNU" Slippers
description:
Hand made slippers reinvented.  Our master cobbler Harun made these slippers by hand with leather soles so that they could be suitable to wear outside.  (This fabric is delicate, we recommend to spray it with Scotchgard.)

This very special fabric is called "Kutnu".  It used to be woven in hand looms.  Sultans the Ottoman Empire wore clothing made from Kutnu and were fitted with the slippers as well.

name: Harmony Oya-Embroidery With Evil-Eye Bead Center (Mavi Boncuk)
description:
The Harmony Oya-Embroidery is our Logo and the Creation. Wonderful Ladies in a Turkish Village made them for us and we share them with you with great pleasure. You can use them in so many ways. They sell 40 pieces in a packet for $25.00. Enjoy.

Less than 2" in diameter
Made with Nylon thread and glass evil-eye bead

name: KESE-Scrub & Peel Factor 50-Sensitive Skin
description:
Reccomended for very sensitive & easily irritated skin.  Use for face and neck.

Once you have been in steam for a while, your skin loosens up and is ready for the "Kese". Slip your hand into the Kese, wrap your wrist with the strap. Start scrubbing up and down. Make sure you do this gently in the beginning as your body yet is not used to it. The dirt and the dead skin cells will start coming off. Do not use soap during this process. Once you have scrubbed your entire body, rinse off. I would highly reccomend using cold or cooler water after exfoliating to shrink your pores down.

Once your body is rinsed with cooler water, cooler than luke warm that is, you can raise the temparature and soap up in the temperature you desire. Your skin cells die every seven days. Do not use Kese more than once a week. Exfoliating with Kese will help your skin be free of any growths, help circulate blood better and feed the skin cells.

By removing dead skin cells, you will generate new skin cells much faster and have healthier skin in relatively short time.

100% Viscose (Beech Fibers)

description:

http://youtu.be/vankaSlfSr0

name: Sultan's Best
description:
Luxury at its best.   This Regular Towel & Peshtemal Mix will take you beyond the clouds.  Soft, comforting and luxurious feeling will not abandon you for quite some time.

Cotton 60%  & Bamboo 40% Mix

YOU MUST WASH YOUR PESHTEMALS PRIOR TO USING THEM. 
 
We recommend washing your Peshtemals in 104 Fahrenheit or lower.   You can drip-dry or put them in your dryer.  Make sure the dryer settings are not too hot.  There will be a small shrinkage after the first wash.

ENJOY YOUR NEW PESHTEMAL; 
YOUR SKIN WILL APPRECIATE IT.
YOUR WALLET WILL LOVE IT.
AND THE ENVIRONMENT WILL LOVE YOU FOR IT!

name: Pure Silk Kese-For Face-Sensitive Skin
description:
This Pure Silk Kese is just large enough to get a couple of fingers in, to delicately and carefully scrub your face.  There are 3 pieces in the packaging to last you a few months.  If you are one with a very sensitive and delicate skin, this Pure Silk Kese is the one for you.

Once you have been in steam for a while, your skin loosens up and is ready for scrubbing. You can do circular motions or up and down. Make sure you do this gently in the beginning as you are yet not used to it. The dirt and the dead skin cells will start coming off. Do not use soap during this process. Once you have scrubbed your entire face, rinse off with cold water to shrink your pores down.
You can now raise the temparature and soap up in the temperature you desire. Your skin cells die every seven days. Do not use Kese more than once a week. Exfoliating with Kese will help your skin be free of any growths, help circulate blood better.  By removing dead skin cells, you will generate new skin cells much faster and have healthier skin in relatively short time.

Pure Silk

name: KESE-Exfoliating Strap -For Back
description:
Once you have been in steam for a while, your skin loosens up and is ready for the "Kese". Place your hands in the handles of your KESE, one hand over the shoulder and the other below, diagonally behind your back and start scrubbing up and down.  You may want to and have to go left-right, up-down, diagonally, according to your needs or body type.  Make sure you do this gently in the beginning as your body yet is not used to it. The dirt and the dead skin cells will start coming off. Do not use soap during this process. Once you have scrubbed your entire back, rinse off with colder water to shrink your pores down.

Once your body is rinsed with cooler water, cooler than luke warm that is, you can raise the temparature and soap up in the temperature you desire. Your skin cells die every seven days. Do not use Kese more than once a week. Exfoliating with Kese will help your skin be free of any growths, help circulate blood better and feed the skin cells.

By removing dead skin cells, you will generate new skin cells much faster and have healthier skin in relatively short time.

100% Viscose (Beech Fibers)

name: Lace-Dantel
description:
I remember lacy curtains from my childhood.  Some times they were hand made lace entirely or the borders were lace.  They were very romantic and beautiful.  The light just came in the right way and the shadows would dance at times.  I loved the lace curtains.

We have border lace for your pleasure.  They are machine made and cotton & synthetic mix.  Sold by yard.

name: Tig OYA-Crochet Embroidery
description:
Painstakingly made, every Tig Oya is different and unique.  Delicate flowers.  You can use each and every piece to adorn whatever you like.  A Turkish Lady made these at home for your pleasure, enjoy them.

There are 40 pieces of Oya on each line.

name: OYA-"Tig Embroidery" (40 in each packet)
description:
We have loose Oya for your pleasure.  You can use them any way you like.  incorporate them into your clothing, accesories, make jewelry out of them.  I am sure you will find many uses for it.  

Pass them on as gift if you like, in any case you will love them.  

Each packet contains 40 loose Oya in various colors.

Sizes vary, 2" or smaller in width or height

name: OYA-"Tig Embroidery" Necklace
description:
We have wonderful OYA Necklaces!.  What is so wonderful about them is you can use them as a necklace, adorn your hair with it, use it with your belt or in place of it.  You can also use them as bracelets.  

Available on Black or White Strings.  There are about 20 Oyas per string.  

Oyas are in varied colors and sizes and no two necklaces are alike.

Length approximately 83" / 211cm.
